body:
# Crystal Plotting Shard `Cryplot` is Crystal plotting library powered by `gnuplot`. The goal of the **Cryplot** is to enable you, **Crystal** programmer, to **conveniently plot beautiful graphs** as easy as in other high-level programming languages. The only external runtime dependencies is [gnuplot](http://www.gnuplot.info/) executable and it need to be in your system path. [gnuplot-palettes](https://github.com/Gnuplotting/gnuplot-palettes) color palettes are downloaded at shard installation and made available to your use via simply invoking the `plot#palette` and passing in any available palette enum `Cryplot::Palette`. ## Installation 1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`: ```yaml dependencies: cryplot: github: naqvis/cryplot ``` 2. Run `shards install` ### Example 1 ```crystal require "cryplot" # Create a vector with values from 0 to 5 divived into 100 uniform intervals x = Cryplot.linspace(0.0, 5.0, 100) # Create a plot object Cryplot.plot { # set color palette palette(:set2) # Draw a sine graph putting x on the x-axis and sin(x) on the y-axis draw_curve(x, x.map { |v| Math.sin(v) }).label("sin(x)").line_width(4) # Draw a cosine graph putting x on the x-axis and cos(x) on the y-axis draw_curve(x, x.map { |v| Math.cos(v) }).label("cos(x)").line_width(4) # Show the plot in a pop-up window show # Save the plot a PDF file save("plot.pdf") } ``` Running above sample code will produce and show you following plot:

### Example 2 (Use custom gnuplot commands) ```crystal require "cryplot" time = [0.0, 1.0, 2.1, 3.1, 4.2, 5.2, 6.2, 7.2, 8.2, 9.1, 10.0, 11.0, 12.0, 12.9, 13.8, 14.9, 15.9, 17.0, 17.9, 18.9, 20.0, 21.0, 22.0, 23.0, 24.0, 25.0, 26.0, 27.0, 28.0, 29.0, 30.0, 31.0, 32.0, 32.9, 33.8, 34.7, 35.7, 36.6, 37.7] angle = [-14.7, 8.6, 28.8, 46.7, 47.4, 36.5, 37.0, 5.1, -11.2, -22.4, -35.5, -33.6, -21.1, -15.0, -1.6, 19.5, 27.5, 32.6, 27.5, 20.2, 13.8, -1.3, -24.5, -25.0, -25.0, -20.2, -9.9, 5.8, 14.7, 21.8, 29.8, 21.4, 24.6, 25.8, 0.6, -16.6, -24.0, -24.6, -19.8] stdvar = [3.6, 3.6, 3.0, 3.4, 3.5, 3.4, 10.3, 3.4, 3.4, 3.5, 3.6, 3.9, 3.9, 4.2, 2.7, 3.2, 2.8, 3.5, 2.7, 3.3, 3.4, 4.2, 6.7, 3.3, 3.1, 3.6, 3.2, 3.2, 3.0, 3.5, 2.7, 4.1, 2.7, 12.0, 2.9, 3.2, 3.7, 3.8, 3.5] Cryplot.plot { # Set the Title of the plort title("Cavendish Data").title_font_size(20).title_text_color("blue") # Set x-axix and y-axis labels xlabel("Time (s)") ylabel("Angle (mrad)") # Adjust the Legend position legend.at_top_right # Adjust grid , border, style, tics settings grid .show .back .line_width(1) border.none style_fill.border_show tics.hide border.left.right.top.bottom.back # Draw Error Bars draw_error_bars_y(time, angle, stdvar).line_width(2).line_color("purple").label_none # Draw raw-data line by using the same dataset draw("1:2", "lines").line_color("green").line_width(2).label("raw data") # custom gnuplot commands (these commands are passed as-is to gnuplot) gnuplot("theta(t) = theta0 + a * exp(-t / tau) * sin(2 * pi * t / T + phi)") gnuplot("fit theta(x) '#{data_filename}' using 1:2:3 via a, tau, phi, T, theta0") # draw best fit curve draw("theta(x)", "", "").label("best-fit curve").line_width(3).line_color("orange") # Set the size size(480, 380) # Show the plot in a pop-up window show # Save the plot in PNG file save("best-fit-curve.png") } ``` Running above sample code will produce and show you following plot:

Refer to `specs` or `examples` folder for further samples. ## Available Color Palettes Do you want to change the colors? All available color palettes and their names can be found [here][gnuplot-palettes]. [gnuplot-palettes]: https://github.com/naqvis/gnuplot-palettes ## Development To run all tests: ``` crystal spec ``` ## Contributing 1. Fork it () 2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`) 3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`) 4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`) 5. Create a new Pull Request ## Contributors - [Ali Naqvi](https://github.com/naqvis) - creator and maintainer

def.name: figure
def.body:
fig = Figure.new(plots)
with fig yield fig

class_methods.name: linspace
class_methods.doc: Returns an array with uniform increments from a given initial value to a final one
class_methods.summary: Returns an array with uniform increments from a given initial value to a final one
class_methods.args_string: (x0 : T, x1 : T1, intervals : Int) : Array(Float64) forall T, T1
class_methods.args_html: (x0 : T, x1 : T1, intervals : Int) : Array(Float64) forall T, T1

def.name: linspace
def.body:
res = Array(Float64).new(intervals + 1)
0.upto(intervals - 1) do |i|
  res << (x0 + ((i * (x1 - x0)) / intervals.to_f))
end
res

plot = Plot.new

class_methods.summary: Return an array with unit increment from a given initial value to a final one

def.name: range
def.body:
incr = (x1 > x0) ? 1 : -1
Array(Float64).new((x1 - x0).abs + 1) do |i| (x0 + (i * incr)).to_f end

instance_methods.name: save
instance_methods.doc:
Save the plot in a file, with its extension defining the file format.
The extension of the file name determines the file format
The supported formats are: `pdf`, `eps`, `svg`, `png`, and `jpeg`
Thus, to save a plot in `pdf` format, choose a file as in `plot.pdf`.
Note: This removes temporary files after saving if `autoclean` is enabled. default is enabled
instance_methods.summary: Save the plot in a file, with its extension defining the file format.

def.name: save
def.body:
cleanedfilename = Gnuplot.cleanpath(filename)


if (idx = cleanedfilename.rindex('.'))
  extension = cleanedfilename[(idx + 1)..].downcase
else
  extension = "pdf"
end

script = File.new(@script_filename, mode: "w")
Gnuplot.palettecmd(script, palette)


width = @width == 0 ? Consts::DEFAULT_FIGURE_WIDTH : @width
height = @height == 0 ? Consts::DEFAULT_FIGURE_HEIGHT : @height
size = Gnuplot.sizestr(width, height, extension == "pdf")
Gnuplot.saveterminalcmd(script, extension, size, @font.repr)


Gnuplot.outputcmd(script, cleanedfilename)


script << self


script << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
script << "set output"


script << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
script.close


save_plot_data


Gnuplot.runscript(@script_filename, false)


if autoclean
  cleanup
end

instance_methods.name: save_plot_data
instance_methods.doc: write the current plot data to data file
instance_methods.summary: write the current plot data to data file

instance_methods.name: show
instance_methods.doc:
Show the plot in a popup-window
Note: This removes temporary files after saving if `autoclean` is enabled. default is enabled
instance_methods.summary: Show the plot in a popup-window Note: This removes temporary files after saving if #autoclean is enabled.

def.name: show
def.body:
script = File.new(@script_filename, mode: "w")

Gnuplot.palettecmd(script, palette)


width = @width == 0 ? Consts::DEFAULT_FIGURE_WIDTH : @width
height = @height == 0 ? Consts::DEFAULT_FIGURE_HEIGHT : @height
size = Gnuplot.sizestr(width, height, false)
Gnuplot.showterminalcmd(script, size, @font.repr)


script << self


script << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
script.close


save_plot_data


Gnuplot.runscript(@script_filename, true)


if autoclean
  cleanup
end

def.name: repr
def.body:
show = show_repr
if show == "no"
  return "unset #{axis}tics"
end
(String.build do |sb|
  if @logscale_base.blank?
  else
    sb << "set logscale #{axis} #{@logscale_base}\n"
  end
  (((sb << "set ") << axis) << "tics") << " "
  (sb << @along) << " "
  (sb << @mirror) << " "
  (sb << @inout) << " "
  ((((sb << "scale ") << @scalemajor) << ",") << @scaleminor) << " "
  (sb << @rotate) << " "
  (sb << offset_repr) << " "
  (sb << text_repr) << " "
  sb << @format
end.squeeze(' ')).strip

instance_methods.name: repr
instance_methods.doc: returns a string representation of object of some class
instance_methods.summary: returns a string representation of object of some class

def.name: repr
def.body:
u = @using
if @xtic.blank?
else
  u = u + ":#{@xtic}"
end
if @ytic.blank?
else
  u = u + ":#{@ytic}"
end
(String.build do |sb|
  (sb << @what) << " "
  if u.blank?
  else
    sb << "using #{u} "
  end
  (sb << @title) << " "
  if @axes.blank?
  else
    sb << "axes #{@axes} "
  end
  if @with.blank?
  else
    sb << "with #{@with} "
  end
  (sb << filled_curve_repr) << " "


  if !@palette.blank?
    sb << "linecolor #{@palette} "

    if @line_type.blank?
    else
      (sb << @line_type) << " "
    end
    if @line_width.blank?
    else
      (sb << @line_width) << " "
    end
    if @dash_type.blank?
    else
      (sb << @dash_type) << " "
    end
  elsif !@line_color.blank?
    if @line_type.blank?
    else
      (sb << @line_type) << " "
    end
    if @line_width.blank?
    else
      (sb << @line_width) << " "
    end
    (sb << @line_color) << " "
    if @dash_type.blank?
    else
      (sb << @dash_type) << " "
    end
  else
    (sb << line_repr) << " "
  end
  if @variable_pointsize
    sb << "pointsize variable "
  end
  (sb << point_repr) << " "
  (sb << fill_repr) << " "
end.squeeze(' ')).strip

instance_methods.name: save
instance_methods.doc:
Save the plots in a file, with its extension defining the file format.
The extension of the file name determines the file format
The supported formats are: `pdf`, `eps`, `svg`, `png`, and `jpeg`
Thus, to save a plot in `pdf` format, choose a file as in `plot.pdf`.
Note: This removes temporary files after saving if `autoclean` is enabled. default is enabled
instance_methods.summary: Save the plots in a file, with its extension defining the file format.

def.name: save
def.body:
cleanedfilename = Gnuplot.cleanpath(filename)


if (idx = cleanedfilename.rindex('.'))
  extension = cleanedfilename[(idx + 1)..].downcase
else
  extension = "pdf"
end

script = File.new(@script_filename, mode: "w")
Gnuplot.palettecmd(script, @palette)


width = @width == 0 ? Consts::DEFAULT_FIGURE_WIDTH : @width
height = @height == 0 ? Consts::DEFAULT_FIGURE_HEIGHT : @height
size = Gnuplot.sizestr(width, height, extension == "pdf")
Gnuplot.saveterminalcmd(script, extension, size, @font.repr)


Gnuplot.outputcmd(script, cleanedfilename)

Gnuplot.multiplotcmd(script, @layout_rows, @layout_cols, @title)


@plots.each do |p|
  script << p
end


(script << "unset multiplot") << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE


script << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
script << "set output"


script << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
script.close


save_plot_data


Gnuplot.runscript(@script_filename, false)


if @autoclean
  cleanup
end

instance_methods.name: show
instance_methods.doc:
Show the plot in a popup-window
Note: This removes temporary files after saving if `autoclean` is enabled. default is enabled
instance_methods.summary: Show the plot in a popup-window Note: This removes temporary files after saving if #autoclean is enabled.

def.name: show
def.body:
script = File.new(@script_filename, mode: "w")

Gnuplot.palettecmd(script, @palette)


width = @width == 0 ? Consts::DEFAULT_FIGURE_WIDTH : @width
height = @height == 0 ? Consts::DEFAULT_FIGURE_HEIGHT : @height
size = Gnuplot.sizestr(width, height, false)
Gnuplot.showterminalcmd(script, size, @font.repr)


Gnuplot.multiplotcmd(script, @layout_rows, @layout_cols, @title)


@plots.each do |p|
  script << p
end


script << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
script.close


save_plot_data


Gnuplot.runscript(@script_filename, true)


if @autoclean
  cleanup
end

def.name: fill_repr
def.body:
fill_style = case @fill_mode
when "solid"
  "fillstyle #{@transparent} solid #{@density}"
when "pattern"
  "fillstyle #{@transparent} pattern #{@pattern_number}"
when "empty"
  "fillstyle empty"
else
  ""
end

border_style = ""
if @bordershow.blank?
elsif @bordershow == "yes"
  border_style = "border "
  if @bordercolor.blank?
  else
    border_style = border_style + "linecolor #{@bordercolor} "
  end
  if @borderlinewidth.blank?
  else
    border_style = border_style + "linewidth #{@borderlinewidth} "
  end
else
  border_style = "noborder"
end

def.name: repr
def.body:
fill_style = case @fillmode
when "solid"
  "#{@transparent} solid #{@density}"
when "pattern"
  "#{@transparent} pattern #{@pattern_number}"
when "empty"
  "empty"
else
  ""
end

border_style = ""
if @bordershow.blank?
elsif @bordershow == "yes"
  border_style = "border "
  if @bordercolor.blank?
  else
    border_style = border_style + "linecolor #{@bordercolor} "
  end
  if @borderlinewidth.blank?
  else
    border_style = border_style + "linewidth #{@borderlinewidth} "
  end
else
  border_style = "noborder"
end

if fill_style.blank? && border_style.blank?
  return ""
end

(String.build do |sb|
  sb << "set style fill "
  (sb << fill_style) << " "
  sb << border_style
end.squeeze(' ')).strip

instance_methods.doc: returns a string representation of object of some class
instance_methods.summary: returns a string representation of object of some class

def.name: repr
def.body:
show = show_repr
if show == "no"
  return "unset key"
end
title = title_repr
if title.size > 0
  title = title + " #{@title_loc}"
end
(String.build do |sb|
  sb << "set key "
  (((sb << @placement) << " ") << @opaque) << " "
  (sb << @alignment) << " "
  (sb << @justification) << " "
  (sb << @invert) << " "
  (sb << @reverse) << " "
  sb << "width #{@width_increment} "
  sb << "height #{@height_increment} "
  sb << "samplen #{@samplen} "
  sb << "spacing #{@spacing} "
  (sb << text_repr) << " "
  (sb << title) << " "
  (sb << frame_repr) << " "
  sb << "maxrows #{@maxrows} "
  sb << "maxcols #{@maxcols} "
end.squeeze(' ')).strip

instance_methods.name: add
instance_methods.doc: Add more tics to be displayed with given tic values and corresponding labels.
instance_methods.summary: Add more tics to be displayed with given tic values and corresponding labels.

def.name: add
def.body:
if values.size < labels.size
  raise(ArgumentError.new("values and labels should of same size"))
end
@add = String.build do |sb|
  sb << "add ("
  values.each_with_index do |v, i|
    (sb << (i == 0 ? "" : ", ")) << "'#{labels[i]}' #{v}"
  end
  sb << ")"
end
self

def.name: interval
def.body:
if increment <= 0.0
  raise(ArgumentError.new("The increment argment must be positive"))
end
if end_ <= start
  raise(ArgumentError.new("The end_ argument must be greater than start"))
end
@at = "#{start}, #{increment}, #{end_}"
self

instance_methods.name: repr
instance_methods.doc: returns a string representation of object of some class
instance_methods.summary: returns a string representation of object of some class

def.name: repr
def.body:
base = repr(@axis)
if hidden?
  return base
end

if @start.size > 0 && @increment.blank?
  raise("You have called start method but not increment")
end
if @end.size > 0 && @increment.blank?
  raise("You have called end method but not increment")
end
if @end.size > 0 && @start.blank?
  raise("You have called end method but not start")
end

(String.build do |sb|
  (sb << base) << " "
  (sb << @at) << " "
  (sb << @add) << " "
end.squeeze(' ')).strip

instance_methods.name: annotate
instance_methods.doc:
Add a text annotation at the specified position.
Position can be in data coordinates (default), graph coordinates (0-1), or screen coordinates.
instance_methods.summary: Add a text annotation at the specified position.
instance_methods.args_string: (x : Number, y : Number, text : String, options : String = "")
instance_methods.args_html: (x : Number, y : Number, text : String, options : String = "")

def.name: annotate
def.body:
tag = @annotation_counter = @annotation_counter + 1
cmd = "set label #{tag} '#{text}' at #{x},#{y}"
if options.blank?
else
  cmd = cmd + " #{options}"
end
gnuplot(cmd)
self

instance_methods.args_html: (x : Number, y : Number, text : String, options : String = "")

def.body:
tag = @annotation_counter = @annotation_counter + 1
cmd = "set label #{tag} '#{text}' at graph #{x},#{y}"

end

self

instance_methods.doc: Add an arrow from (x1, y1) to (x2, y2).
instance_methods.summary: Add an arrow from (x1, y1) to (x2, y2).
instance_methods.args_string: (x1 : Number, y1 : Number, x2 : Number, y2 : Number, options : String = "")
instance_methods.args_html: (x1 : Number, y1 : Number, x2 : Number, y2 : Number, options : String = "")

def.name: arrow
def.body:
tag = @arrow_counter = @arrow_counter + 1
cmd = "set arrow #{tag} from #{x1},#{y1} to #{x2},#{y2}"

instance_methods.name: draw_boxplot
instance_methods.doc:
Draw a box plot (box-and-whisker plot) for the given data.
Each element in data represents a group/category.
instance_methods.summary: Draw a box plot (box-and-whisker plot) for the given data.

def.name: draw_boxplot
def.body:
data.each_with_index do |group, i|
  if group.empty?
    next
  end

  sorted = group.sort
  n = sorted.size
  min = sorted.first
  max = sorted.last
  q1 = sorted[(n * 0.25).to_i]
  median = sorted[(n * 0.5).to_i]
  q3 = sorted[(n * 0.75).to_i]


  iqr = q3 - q1
  whisker_min = [min, q1 - (1.5 * iqr)].max
  whisker_max = [max, q3 + (1.5 * iqr)].min

  x_pos = (i + 1).to_f
  @data = @data + String.build do |sb|
    (sb << "#==============================================================================") << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
    (((sb << "# DATASET #") << @numdatasets) << " (boxplot)") << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
    (sb << "#==============================================================================") << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
    (sb << "#{x_pos} #{whisker_min} #{q1} #{median} #{q3} #{whisker_max}") << "\n\n"
  end

  label = labels.try(&.[]?(i)) || "Group #{i + 1}"
  ((draw("'#{@data_filename}' index #{@numdatasets}", "1:2:3:4:5:6", "candlesticks"))
    .label(label))
    .line_style(@drawspecs.size)
  @numdatasets = @numdatasets + 1
end
self

instance_methods.name: draw_heatmap
instance_methods.doc:
Draw a heatmap from a 2D matrix.
The matrix should be an array of arrays where matrix[row][col] = value.
instance_methods.summary: Draw a heatmap from a 2D matrix.

def.name: draw_heatmap
def.body:
rows = matrix.size
if rows == 0
  return self
end
cols = matrix[0].size
if cols == 0
  return self
end

x = Array(Float64).new
y = Array(Float64).new
z = Array(Float64).new

rows.times do |i|
  cols.times do |j|
    x << j.to_f
    y << i.to_f
    z << matrix[i][j]
  end
end


gnuplot("set pm3d map")
gnuplot("set palette")
draw_with_vecs("pm3d", x, y, z)

instance_methods.name: draw_heatmap_labeled
instance_methods.doc:
Draw a labeled heatmap from a 2D matrix with row and column labels.
Useful for correlation matrices, confusion matrices, etc.
matrix: 2D array where matrix[row][col] = value
row_labels: labels for y-axis (rows)
col_labels: labels for x-axis (columns)
value_range: optional tuple {min, max} for color scale (e.g., {-1.0, 1.0} for correlation)
instance_methods.summary: Draw a labeled heatmap from a 2D matrix with row and column labels.

def.name: draw_heatmap_labeled
def.body:
rows = matrix.size
if rows == 0
  return self
end
cols = matrix[0].size
if cols == 0
  return self
end


gnuplot("$heatmap_data << EOD")

gnuplot("," + (col_labels.join(",")))

rows.times do |i|
  row_data = (row_labels[i] + ",") + (matrix[i].map do |v| (v.round(3)).to_s end.join(","))
  gnuplot(row_data)
end
gnuplot("EOD")

  gnuplot("set cbrange [#{vr[0]}:#{vr[1]}]")
end
gnuplot("unset key")
gnuplot("set tics scale 0")
gnuplot("set xtics rotate by -45")


draw("'$heatmap_data' matrix rowheaders columnheaders", "1:2:3", "image")

def.name: draw_with_vecs
def.body:
use = ""
@data = @data + String.build do |sb|
  Gnuplot.writedataset(sb, @numdatasets, x, *vecs)




  if x.is_a?(Array(String))
    nvecs = vecs.size
    use = "0:"
    2.upto(nvecs + 1) do |i|
      use = use + "#{i}:"
    end
    use = use + "xtic(1)"
  end
end

val = (draw("'#{@data_filename}' index #{@numdatasets}", use, with_)).line_style(@drawspecs.size)
@numdatasets = @numdatasets + 1
val

instance_methods.name: heatmap_palette
instance_methods.doc:
Set the color palette for heatmaps.
Predefined options: :diverging (red-white-green), :sequential (white-blue), :thermal (black-red-yellow-white)
instance_methods.summary: Set the color palette for heatmaps.

def.name: heatmap_palette
def.body:
case style
when :diverging
  gnuplot("set palette defined (-1 '#d73027', 0 '#ffffbf', 1 '#1a9850')")
when :sequential
  gnuplot("set palette defined (0 '#f7fbff', 1 '#08306b')")
when :thermal
  gnuplot("set palette defined (0 '#000000', 0.33 '#ff0000', 0.67 '#ffff00', 1 '#ffffff')")
when :viridis
  gnuplot("set palette defined (0 '#440154', 0.25 '#3b528b', 0.5 '#21918c', 0.75 '#5ec962', 1 '#fde725')")
end
self

def.name: repr
def.body:
String.build do |script|

  (script << "#==============================================================================") << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << "# SETUP COMMANDS") << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << "#==============================================================================") << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  if title.repr.blank?
  else
    script << "set #{title.repr} #{Gnuplot::NEW_LINE}"
  end
  script << (Gnuplot.command_value_str("set xrange", @xrange))
  script << (Gnuplot.command_value_str("set yrange", @yrange))
  script << (Gnuplot.command_value_str("set y2range", @y2range))
  (script << @xlabel) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @ylabel) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @y2label) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @zlabel) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @rlabel) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @border) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @grid) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << style_fill) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @style_histogram) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @tics) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @xtics_major_bottom) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @xtics_major_top) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @xtics_minor_bottom) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @xtics_minor_top) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @ytics_major_left) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @ytics_major_right) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @ytics_minor_left) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @ytics_minor_right) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @ztics_major) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @ztics_minor) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @rtics_major) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @rtics_minor) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @legend) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  script << (Gnuplot.command_value_str("set boxwidth", @boxwidth))
  script << (Gnuplot.command_value_str("set samples", @samples))
  script << (Gnuplot.command_value_str("set datafile missing", MISSING_INDICATOR))

  if @customcmds.empty?
  else
    (script << "#==============================================================================") << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
    (script << "# CUSTOM EXPLICIT GNUPLOT COMMANDS") << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
    (script << "#==============================================================================") << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
    @customcmds.each do |c|
      (script << c) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
    end
  end


  (script << "#==============================================================================") << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << "# PLOT COMMANDS") << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << "#==============================================================================") << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE


  n = @drawspecs.size
  if n > 0
    script << "plot \\\n"


    0.upto(n - 1) do |i|
      ((script << "    ") << @drawspecs[i].repr) << (i < (n - 1) ? ", \\\n" : "")
    end
  end


  script << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
end

instance_methods.name: draw_with_vecs
instance_methods.doc: Draw plot object with given style and given vectors (e.g., `plot.draw("lines", x, y)`).
instance_methods.summary: Draw plot object with given style and given vectors (e.g., plot.draw("lines", x, y)).
instance_methods.args_string: (with_ : String, x : X, *vecs : Array) : Draw forall X
instance_methods.args_html: (with_ : String, x : X, *vecs : Array) : Draw forall X

def.name: draw_with_vecs
def.body:
use = ""
@data = @data + String.build do |sb|
  Gnuplot.writedataset(sb, @numdatasets, x, *vecs)




  if x.is_a?(Array(String))
    nvecs = vecs.size
    use = "0:"
    2.upto(nvecs + 1) do |i|
      use = use + "#{i}:"
    end
    use = use + "xtic(1)"
  end
end

val = (draw("'#{@data_filename}' index #{@numdatasets}", use, with_)).line_style(@drawspecs.size)
@numdatasets = @numdatasets + 1
val

def.name: repr
def.body:
String.build do |script|

  (script << "#==============================================================================") << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << "# SETUP COMMANDS") << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << "#==============================================================================") << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  if title.repr.blank?
  else
    script << "set #{title.repr} #{Gnuplot::NEW_LINE}"
  end
  script << (Gnuplot.command_value_str("set xrange", @xrange))
  script << (Gnuplot.command_value_str("set yrange", @yrange))
  script << (Gnuplot.command_value_str("set zrange", @zrange))
  (script << @xlabel) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @ylabel) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @zlabel) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @rlabel) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @border) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @grid) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << style_fill) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @style_histogram) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @tics) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @xtics_major_bottom) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @xtics_major_top) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @xtics_minor_bottom) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @xtics_minor_top) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @ytics_major_left) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @ytics_major_right) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @ytics_minor_left) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @ytics_minor_right) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @ztics_major) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @ztics_minor) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @rtics_major) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @rtics_minor) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << @legend) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  script << (Gnuplot.command_value_str("set boxwidth", @boxwidth))
  script << (Gnuplot.command_value_str("set samples", @samples))


  if @customcmds.empty?
  else
    (script << "#==============================================================================") << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
    (script << "# CUSTOM EXPLICIT GNUPLOT COMMANDS") << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
    (script << "#==============================================================================") << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
    @customcmds.each do |c|
      (script << c) << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
    end
  end


  (script << "#==============================================================================") << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << "# PLOT COMMANDS") << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  (script << "#==============================================================================") << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
  script << "splot \\\n"


  n = @drawspecs.size
  0.upto(n - 1) do |i|
    ((script << "    ") << @drawspecs[i].repr) << (i < (n - 1) ? ", \\\n" : "")
  end


  script << Gnuplot::NEW_LINE
end
